intro: Brickellia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers in clusters, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Brickellia squarrosa is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ornamental value in native plant gardens.
